public that the establishment heretofore conducted by

continue the business in all its branches at the old stand
corner OF Talnall and Queen Streets near the Fends Meet

full articles.headline: TO BE RENTED,
full articles.article:
fs- A House and small Farm in the village of
GE9f Newark lately occupied by the Rev. SAMuE1
Hsssl BKLI possession of which will be gwen the
"l 25th day of March next.


The Farm about forty of arabic land and
meadow, in good order, and conveniently divided. The
Improvements good brick dwelling house and kch-
a. with brickbarn carriage house and other out build
ings.


This property would be very suitable for family who
might be desrous of removing to Newark to educate chill
dren. There excellent seminaries in that village
the Newark Academy which is under the direction Of the
Rev A. X RrssEIL aided by two assistants in which boys
taught the Latin and Greek Languages Mathematics
acand school for young Ladies under the direction OF
the Rev. SxuEL BELL in which taught the useful and
ornamental branches of Female Education.


For terms apply in Wilmington to Mrs. MARY BLACK,
to the subscriber in Newcastle. J. X. BLACK
